clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of the "Ten Steps for Healthy Feeding of Children Younger Than Two Years" in Health Centers
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of the "Ten Steps for Healthy Feeding of Children Younger Than Two Years" in Health Centers

clinical_study.source: Federal University of Health Science of Porto Alegre

brief_summary.textblock: A cluster randomized field trial to evaluate the impact that training healthcare workers in healthy feeding practices has on the nutrition and health of children.

detailed_description.textblock:
A cluster randomized controlled trial. Twenty health care service sites were randomly assigned to the intervention or control groups. Health care workers of the intervention health care service sites received training based on the programme "Ten steps for healthy feeding for children from birth to two years old".
Pregnant women, in their third term, were enrolled in the study. At 6 and 12 months of age, the mothers were interviewed at home using a semi-structured questionnaire with pre-coded close- and open-ended questions and the children were evaluated.
When the children are 3 years old, the mothers will be interviewed at home again and the mothers and the children will be evaluated.

primary_outcome.measure: Effectiveness of a nutrition advice programme in exclusive breastfeeding at six months of age
primary_outcome.time_frame: Six months after the beginning of the study

primary_outcome.measure: Effectiveness of a nutrition advice programme in exclusive breastfeeding at twelve months of age
primary_outcome.time_frame: Twelve months after the beginning of the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Effectiveness of a nutrition advice programme in decrease of morbidity (diarrhea, respiratory problems and fever), use of medication, anemia and hospitalization and improve nutritional status at twelve months of age
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Twelve months after the beginning of the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Effectiveness of a nutrition advice programme in decrease of morbidity (diarrhea, respiratory problems and fever), use of medication, anemia and hospitalization and improve nutritional status at six months of age
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Six months after the beginning of the study

other_outcome.measure: Effectiveness of a nutrition advice programme on food consumption and nutritional status of preschool children.
other_outcome.time_frame: Three years after the beginning of the study

clinical_study.condition: Feeding and Eating Disorders of Childhood

intervention.description: The content of the dietary intervention follows the recommendations of the guidelines of the Brazilian Ministry of Health for healthy feeding of children younger then two years.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All pregnant women in the last quarter of the gestation.
Exclusion Criteria:
- HIV-positive mothers
- congenital malformation
